node_2: loosely based on the japanese dragon ball manga series created by akira toriyama
edge: Dragonball Evolution is a 2009 American superhero film loosely based on the Japanese Dragon Ball manga series created by Akira Toriyama.
In the film, the teenager Goku reveals his past
Goku sets out to fight the evil alien warlord Lord Piccolo who wishes to gain the powerful Dragon Balls and use them to take over Earth.
Lord Piccolo wishes to gain the powerful Dragon Balls
Goku is a fighter

node_2: first official live-action adaptation of the dragon ball series
edge: Dragonball Evolution is the first official live-action adaptation of the Dragon Ball series.
Dragonball Evolution stars Justin Chatwin
Dragonball Evolution stars Emmy Rossum
Dragonball Evolution stars James Marsters
Dragonball Evolution stars Jamie Chung
Dragonball Evolution stars Chow Yun-fat
Dragonball Evolution stars Joon Park
Dragonball Evolution stars Eriko Tamura
Dragonball Evolution was distributed in Japan and several other Asian countries on March 13, 2009.
Dragonball Evolution was released in North America on April 10, 2009.
Dragonball Evolution was a commercial failure.

In 2002, when 20th Century Fox acquired the live-action feature film rights to the Dragon Ball franchise from Shueisha, publisher of Toriyama's original manga series, Akira Toriyama was engaged by 20th Century Fox as a creative consultant.
James Wong and RatPac-Dune Entertainment co-founder Brett Ratner were announced as director and producer respectively, and the project was retitled Dragonball.
Ron Perlman was originally offered the role of the villain Lord Piccolo, but turned it down to work on Hellboy II: The Golden Army.
Piccolo was 'thousands of years old and a very long time ago he used to be a force of good'
Marsters and the make-up artist chose to give him a decrepit complexion to reflect his having been trapped for thousands of years stewing in his evil and thirst for vengeance.

Originally, Piccolo was going to be depicted as a handsome creature, but Marsters and the make-up artist chose to give him a decrepit complexion instead of casting Zhang Yuqi for the part of Chi Chi, with whom he worked on CJ7.
Stephen Chow originally wanted to cast Zhang Yuqi, with whom he worked on CJ7, for the part of Chi Chi.
Principal photography began on December 3, 2007, in Mexico City,
Locations included the Universidad Tecnológica de México.
Shooting was also scheduled at Los Angeles,
The crew moved to Estado de México in March of that year for some shots at Nevado de Toluca.
Dragonball Evolution was shot in an abandoned jeans factory, also located in Durango, Mexico.
Dragonball Evolution was shot in an abandoned jeans factory, also located in Durango, Mexico.
Dragonball Evolution special effects were done by Amalgamated Dynamics,
Dragonball Evolution visual effects were done by Ollin Studios, Zoic Studios, and Imagine Engine.
It was confirmed that the theme song would be "Rule" by Japanese singer Ayumi Hamasaki for Dragonball Evolution.
A film novelization, Dragonball Evolution: The Junior Novel, was written by Stacia Deutsch and Rhody Cohon. Aimed at children ages 8–15, the novel was released by Viz Media on February 24, 2009.
The July 2008 issue of Jump Square published a manga by Daisuke Kadokuni, inspired by the Dragonball: Evolution.

Jason Di Rosso mentioned 'dull high school movie banter' dialog in his review
Slant Magazine's Rob Humanick used the word 'uninspired' to describe the film in his review
As of August 19th, 2024, Dragonball Evolution holds the record as the lowest-rated film on Letterboxd with a 0.9 rating.
According to Jeffrey K. Lyles of The Gazette, Chatwin was ill-cast as Goku in the film Dragonball Evolution.
Toriyama wrote: "I had put Dragon Ball behind me, but seeing how much that live-action film ticked me off..."
Actor James Marsters expressed feelings that he was misled about Dragonball: Evolution

Following Akira Toriyama's death, Justin Chatwin sent condolences while also apologizing for the quality of Dragonball Evolution. This indicates that Akira Toriyama is associated with the creation of Dragonball and possibly played a role in the making or development of the film.
James Marsters played King Piccolo in Dragonball Evolution, indicating an association between the character and the film.
The planned arc will feature elements from Dragon Ball Z.
Piccolo's reincarnation and redemption may merge Piccolo and his son Piccolo Jr. Into one character.

Chatwin and Chung expressed their hopes that Goku's best friend Krillin would be included in a sequel, noting "their dynamic in the anime's just too good not to use in this movie. If the studio knew better, they’d already have people lined up for auditions".
The film's poor commercial and critical performance caused any planned sequels to be canceled.
